alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Interior Hancock; Northern Washington; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 9:36AM EST until January 17 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and mixed precipitation expected. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches for a storm total of 3 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, Interior DownEast and Penobscot Valley Maine. * WHEN...Until 3 PM EST this afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. Damage to trees and power lines is possible.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow, sleet or freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Expect slippery roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
